dt: {bc}a sum of money payable yearly or at other regular intervals
{bc}a contract or agreement providing for the payment of an annuity

et: Middle English {it}annuite{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}annuité{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}annuitat-, annuitas{/it}, from Latin {it}annuus{/it} yearly
shortdef: a sum of money payable yearly or at other regular intervals
the right to receive an annuity
a contract or agreement providing for the payment of an annuity

dt: {bc}a mortgage that allows an elderly person to convert home equity into available funds through a line of credit, cash advance, or periodic disbursements to be repaid with interest usually when the borrower dies, moves, or sells the home

shortdef: a mortgage that allows an elderly person to convert home equity into available funds through a line of credit, cash advance, or periodic disbursements to be repaid with interest usually when the borrower dies, moves, or sells the home
